register.description: The ISC Region 0 Control Register defines the control fields for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp0 region 0 ISC.

bitfield.description: Clear output priv attribute. If each bit is set then the outgoing priv bit is cleared.
Set outgoing priv attribute. If each bit is set then the outgoing priv bit is set.
No privID replacement, pass through value.
Make outgoing non-secure.
Make outgoing secure. A value of 0xA enables, others disable.
Priv ID.
Default region indication. The default region is used when all other regions do not match.
Enable channel mode to match region to a chanid value. Otherwise use address mode to match region to an address range.
Lock region. Once set the region values cannot be modified.
Enable region. A value of 0xA enables, others disable.

register.description: The ISC Region 0 Start Address Low Register defines the start address bits 31 to 0 for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp0 region 0 ISC.

bitfield.description: Start address bits 31 to 12.
Start address bits 11 to 0 must be 0 as address must be 4KB aligned in address mode. Can also be channel number in channel mode.

register.description: The ISC Region 0 Start Address High Register defines the start address bits 47 to 32 for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp0 region 0 ISC.

bitfield.description: Start address bits 47 to 32.

register.description: The ISC Region 0 End Address Low Register defines the end included address bits 31 to 0 for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp0 region 0 ISC.

bitfield.description: End address bits 31 to 12 to include in the match.
End address bits 11 to 0 are forced to Fs as address must be 4KB aligned.

register.description: The ISC Region 0 End Address High Register defines the end address bits 47 to 32 for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp0 region 0 ISC.

bitfield.description: End address bits 47 to 32.

register.description: The ISC Default Region Control Register defines the control fields for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp0 region 1 ISC.

bitfield.description: Clear output priv attribute. If each bit is set then the outgoing priv bit is cleared, else the bit is unchanged. Do not set both priv and nopriv for the same bit.
Set outgoing priv attribute. If each bit is set then the outgoing priv bit is set, else the bit is unchanged. Do not set both priv and nopriv for the same bit.
No privID replacement. A value of 1 will pass through privid value. A value of 0 will replace privid with priv_id field value.
Make outgoing non-secure. A value of 1 forces secure clear, others do nothing. Do not set both sec and nonsec.
Make outgoing secure. A value of 0xA forces secure set, others do nothing. Do not set both sec and nonsec.
Priv ID value to use if pass is 0.
Default region indication. The default region is used when all other regions do not match.
Enable channel mode to match region to a chanid value. Otherwise use address mode to match region to an address range.
Lock region. Once set, the region values cannot be modified.
Enable region. A value of 0xA enables, others disable.

register.description: The ISC Region 0 Control Register defines the control fields for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp1 region 0 ISC.

bitfield.description: Clear output priv attribute. If each bit is set then the outgoing priv bit is cleared.
Set outgoing priv attribute. If each bit is set then the outgoing priv bit is set.
No privID replacement, pass through value.
Make outgoing non-secure.
Make outgoing secure. A value of 0xA enables, others disable.
Priv ID.
Default region indication. The default region is used when all other regions do not match.
Enable channel mode to match region to a chanid value. Otherwise use address mode to match region to an address range.
Lock region. Once set the region values cannot be modified.
Enable region. A value of 0xA enables, others disable.

register.description: The ISC Region 0 Start Address Low Register defines the start address bits 31 to 0 for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp1 region 0 ISC.

bitfield.description: Start address bits 31 to 12.
Start address bits 11 to 0 must be 0 as address must be 4KB aligned in address mode. Can also be channel number in channel mode.

register.description: The ISC Region 0 Start Address High Register defines the start address bits 47 to 32 for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp1 region 0 ISC.

bitfield.description: Start address bits 47 to 32.

register.description: The ISC Region 0 End Address Low Register defines the end included address bits 31 to 0 for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp1 region 0 ISC.

bitfield.description: End address bits 31 to 12 to include in the match.
End address bits 11 to 0 are forced to Fs as address must be 4KB aligned.

register.description: The ISC Region 0 End Address High Register defines the end address bits 47 to 32 for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp1 region 0 ISC.

bitfield.description: End address bits 47 to 32.

register.description: The ISC Default Region Control Register defines the control fields for the master Iicss_m_main_0.pr1_mst_vbusp1 region 1 ISC.

bitfield.description: Clear output priv attribute. If each bit is set then the outgoing priv bit is cleared, else the bit is unchanged. Do not set both priv and nopriv for the same bit.
Set outgoing priv attribute. If each bit is set then the outgoing priv bit is set, else the bit is unchanged. Do not set both priv and nopriv for the same bit.
No privID replacement. A value of 1 will pass through privid value. A value of 0 will replace privid with priv_id field value.
Make outgoing non-secure. A value of 1 forces secure clear, others do nothing. Do not set both sec and nonsec.
Make outgoing secure. A value of 0xA forces secure set, others do nothing. Do not set both sec and nonsec.
Priv ID value to use if pass is 0.
Default region indication. The default region is used when all other regions do not match.
Enable channel mode to match region to a chanid value. Otherwise use address mode to match region to an address range.
Lock region. Once set, the region values cannot be modified.
Enable region. A value of 0xA enables, others disable.
